translation.en: Ms. Museveni who is also State Minister for Karamoja Affairs, fought back in the editorial pages of The Monitor that both Pulkol and Kiyonga were, “wolves in sheep’s skins” who were misleading voters to get votes.
translation.lug: Muky. Museveni era nga ye minisita w'eggwanga ow'ensonga z'e Karamoja, yasinziira mu lupapula lwa Monitor n'agamba nti Pulkol ne Kiyonga bombi baali "misege egyeyambazza eddiba ly'endiga” era nti baali babuzaabuza abalonzi basobole okubawa obululu.

translation.en: Ms. Museveni argued that they are both bankrupt politicians struggling to save their political careers by pretending to speak for the Karamoja whom they have failed to serve all these years.
translation.lug: Muky. Museveni yagamba nti abasajja abo bombi bannabyabufuzi abaggwa edda ku mpagala era abaagala okuddamu okuganja eri abalonzi nga beefuula abalwanirira Abakalamoja be baalemwa okuweereza mu bbanga lyonna lye baamala nga bali mu bifo ebyo.

translation.en: On August 17, thirty two of the suspects behind the July 11 Kampala bomb blasts appeared before Magistrate Deo Sejjemba in a heavily guarded courtroom.
translation.lug: Nga Agusito 17, abantu 32 abateeberezebwa okuba emabega wa bbomu ezaabwatuka nga Jjulaayi 11 mu Kampala baleetebwa mu maaso g'omulamuzi Deo Sejjemba mu bukuumi obw'amaanyi.

translation.en: The suspects, which include Somalis, Kenyans, Ugandans and a Pakistani face seventy eight capital offences charges.
translation.lug: Mu bantu abo mwalimu Abasomaali, Bannakenya, Bannayuganda, n'Abapakisitaani era baali babavunaana emisango 78 egya nnaggomola.

translation.en: Before they were remanded back to Luzira prison, the suspects complained that their human rights are being violated in detention.
translation.lug: Bwe baali tebannatwalibwa ku mmeere e Luzira, abantu abo baagamba nti eddembe lyabwe ery'obuntu lityoboolwa mu kkomera.

translation.en: Kale Kayihura said twenty two of the eighty one suspects that have been detained since the bombings will be charged with terrorism,.
translation.lug: Kale Kayihura yagamba nti abantu 22 ku abo 81 abaakwatibwa ku nsonga za bbomu ezo ezaabwatuka bajja kuvunaanwa gwa butujju.

translation.en: Nakawa Chief Magistrate Deo Ssejjemba made a point of ordering media houses to stop publishing details of the police’s investigation of the July 11 attacks.
translation.lug: Ssaabalamuzi mu kkooti y'e Nakawa, Deo Ssejjemba, yagamba bannamawulire balekere awo okufulumya ebikwata ku kunoonyereza kwa poliisi ku bulumbaganyi obwakolebwa nga Jjulaayi 11.

translation.en: Robert Kabushenga, Chief Eexecutive Officer of the New Vision said the order was useless.
translation.lug: Robert Kabushenga, akulira New Vision, yagamba nti ekiragiro ekyo tekigasa.

translation.en: Health issues continued to dominate headlines just weeks after two hundred eighty nine ghost workers were found on the payroll at Mulago hospital.
translation.lug: Ensonga z'eby'obulamu zeeyongera okwogerwako ennyo mu mpapula z'amawulire nga wayisse wiiki ntono oluvannyuma lw'okukizuula nti abakozi 280 abaali basasulwa omusaala mu ddwaliro ly'e Mulago tebaaliyo.

translation.en: On August 17, the health sector received some good news after the World Bank announced that it would provide two hundred sixty billion shillings loan to strengthen health projects across Uganda.
translation.lug: Nga Agusito 17, ekitongole ky'eby'obulamu kyafuna amawulire amalungi nti bbanka y'ensi yonna yali egenda kuwa Uganda obuwumbi 260 okwongera amaanyi mu by'obujjanjabi mu ggwanga.

translation.en: Maternal health in the country is still among the worst in Africa.
translation.lug: Obujjanjabi obuweebwa abakazi abali embuto mu Uganda bwe bumu ku businga okuba obw'omutindo ogwa wansi mu Afirika.

translation.en: Health centres in Pallisa and Kibujku districts this week received a torrent of criticism when numerous patients complained of long waits.
translation.lug: Amalwaliro mu disitulikiti ya Pallisa n'eya Kibujku gaavumirirwa nnyo oluvannyuma lw'abalwadde bangi okwemulugunya nti babalinza nnyo.

translation.en: In Mbarara, a group of nurses stormed the office of the executive director at Mbarara Hospital after they failed to get a promised thirty percent salary increase.
translation.lug: E Mbarara, ekibinja ky'abasawo kyazingako ofiisi ya dayirekita w'eddwaliro ly'e Mbarara oluvannyuma lw'okulemwa okubongeza omusaala ebitundu 30 ku buli kikumi nga bwe baali basuubiziddwa.

translation.en: Lwemiyaga County Member of Parliament, Theodore Ssekikubo, was called before the National Resistance Movement disciplinary committee to answer for election malpractice in the recently concluded district elections.
translation.lug: Omukiisse mu paliyamenti owa Lwemiyaga, Theodore Ssekikubo, yayitibwa okulabika mu maaso g'akakiiko ka NRM akakwasisa empisa okunnyonnyola ebigambibwa nti yeenyigira mu kubba obululu mu kulonda kwa disitulikiti okwali kwakaggwa.

translation.en: Minister for Finance Syda Bumba laid a foundation stone for a nine million dollar Springhill apartments at Lubowa on August 20, as the Managing Director, Mitul Jobanputra looks on.
translation.lug: Minisita w'eby'ensimbi Syda Bumba ng'atteeka ettoffaali ku bizimbe by'e Lubowa ebibalirirwamu ddoola obukadde mwenda, nga August 20, era maneja waabyo, Mitul Jobanputra, amutunuulira.

translation.en: Bbumba invited more investors to Uganda.
translation.lug: Bbumba yayita ba invesita abalala bajje mu Uganda.

translation.en: Jackson Sheila from United States of America lays a wreath on the scene of the July 11 terror attacks at Kyadondo Rugby Club.
translation.lug: Jackson Sheila okuva mu Amerika assa ebimuli awaabwatukira bbomu nga Jjulaayi 11 mu bulumbaganyi bw'abatujju ku Kyadondo Rugby Club.

translation.en: On Monday evening more gunshots were discharged in Lwemiyaga after Ssekikubo and the police confronted each other.
translation.lug: Ku Bbalaza akawungeezi, amasasi amalala gaakubwa e Lwemiyaga oluvannyuma lwa Ssekikubo okwezooba ne poliisi.

translation.en: Police commander Charles Nuwagira says he was roughed up by Ssekikubo and his supporters after police tried to arrest Ssekikubo’s bodyguard Alex Mugabi for assault from previous cases.
translation.lug: Omuduumizi wa poliisi, Charles Nuwagira, agamba nti yayisiddwa bubi Ssekikubo n'abawagizi be oluvannyuma lwa poliisi okugezaako okukwata omukuumi wa Ssekikubo, Alex Mugabi, olw'emisango gye yazza emabega.

translation.en: Ssekikubo demanded the police provide an arrest warrant, but quickly words turned to punches.
translation.lug: Ssekikubo yasaba poliisi emulage ekiwandiiko ekibawa olukusa okukwata omukuumi we, naye mu kaseera katono enguumi zitandika okunyooka.

translation.en: Mugabi has also been charged with attempted murder from an earlier fight with police.
translation.lug: Mugabi era avunaanibwa n'ogw'okugezaako okutta omuntu emabega lwe yalwanagana ne poliisi.

translation.en: Ssekikubo currently faces several criminal charges including obstructing the police on duty, possession of an illegal firearm, and theft.
translation.lug: Ssekikubo kati avunaanibwa emisango egiwerako omuli n'okutaataaganya emirimu gya poliisi, okuba n'emmundu etali mu mateeka, n'obubbi.

translation.en: Makerere academic staff voted to go on strike until their savings with the National Insurance Corporation is properly accounted for.
translation.lug: Abasomesa b'e Makerere baasalawo okwediima okutuusa nga ssente zaabwe mu NIC zikoleddwako.

translation.en: More than five hundred workers have their savings with the National Insurance Corporation.
translation.lug: Abakozi abasukka mu bitaano balina ssente zaabwe mu NIC.

translation.en: The matter of contention is the quantity of money that Makerere saved with National Insurance Corporation between 1996 and 2005.
translation.lug: Embiranyi eva ku muwendo gwa ssente yunivasite y'e Makerere ze yateresa NIC wakkati wa 1996 ne 2005.

translation.en: The university says their savings are worth seventeen billion shillings.
translation.lug: Yunivasite egamba nti yabateresa obuwumbi 17.

translation.en: National Insurance Corporation argues the savings are only thirteen billion shillings.
translation.lug: Ekitongole kya NIC kyo kigamba nti baakiteresa obuwumbi 13 bwokka.

translation.en: On Monday August 23, the first day of class, students arrived on campus to the sight of padlocked doors and empty classrooms.
translation.lug: Nga Bbalaza Agusito 23, olunaku olusooka olw'okusoma, abayizi baatuuka ku yunivasite naye ng'ebibiina biggale era nga temuli muntu n'omu.

translation.en: On August 23, talks between the university and the finance ministry ended after seven hours of discussion without a resolution being reached.
translation.lug: Nga Agusito 23, enteeseganya wakkati wa yunivasite n'ekitongole ky'eby'ensimbi ezaamala essaawa eziwerako zaggwa nga tebatuuse ku kukkaanya.

translation.en: Tanga Odoi, the head of Makerere University Academic Staff Association said the strike, as of now, will continue.
translation.lug: Tanga Odoi, omukulembeze w'ekibiina ekigatta abasomesa ba yunivasite y'e Makerere yagamba nti akeediimo kaali kakyagenda mu maaso.

translation.en: Up to now, in most areas of Uganda, the registers of voters have not yet been displayed so that voters can inspect them.
translation.lug: N'okutuusa kati, mu bitundu bya Uganda ebisinga, enkalala z'abalonzi tezinnatimbibwa balonzi kuzeekenneenya.

translation.en: This is a requirement of the law which the Electoral Commission is most reluctant to apply and besides, the final voters’ registers have not arrived in the country.
translation.lug: Ekyo kyetaagisa mu mateeka naye ekitongole ky'eby'okulonda kironzalonza okukissa mu nkola, ate okugatta ku ekyo enkalala z'okulonda ez'enkomeredde tezinnatuuka mu ggwanga.

translation.en: What registers are to be used in a country like Uganda, where there is rampant scandalous use of government media and the government daily newspaper by one political party?
translation.lug: Nkalala za ngeri ki ezisaanidde okukozesebwa mu ggwanga nga Uganda, emikutu gy'empuliziganya n'empapula z'amawulire ebya gavumenti gye bikozesebwa mu ngeri ya kyekubiira okuwagira ekibiina ekimu?

translation.en: These media trumpet Uganda People's Congress daily as if no other party exists.
translation.lug: Emikutu egyo gyogera nnyo ku UPC nga gy'obeera kye kibiina kyokka ekiri mu ggwanga.

translation.en: Every night, troops are deployed to display Obote’s pictures in towns and to pull down publicity materials of other parties.
translation.lug: Buli kiro, amagye gayungulwa mu kibuga okutimba ebipande bya Obote n'okutimbulula ebipande by'ebibiina ebirala.

translation.en: This is the case in all those towns where Uganda Liberation Army is to be found.
translation.lug: Ekyo kye kikolebwa mu bibuga byonna omuli amagye ga Uganda Liberation Army.

translation.en: The world and Uganda particularly is being told that elections are being held in Uganda.
translation.lug: Ensi yonna ne mu Uganda mwennyini abantu bagambibwa nti mu Uganda mulimu okulonda.

translation.en: The following article was published in the Weekly Topic, a Uganda publication, on Monday December 8th, 1980.
translation.lug: Ekitundu kino kyafulumira mu lupapula oluyitibwa, Weekly Topic, olwa Uganda, nga Bbalaza Ddesemba 8, 1980.

translation.en: It was a special edition since the paper was always produced every Friday of the week.
translation.lug: Olupapula olwo lwali lwa njawulo okuva bwe kiri nti lwafulumanga Lwakutaano.

translation.en: This series is compiled and reproduced by John Njoroge. Uganda Patriotic Movement calls for fresh elections after December.
translation.lug: Ekitundu kino kitegekebwa John Njoroge. Ekibiina kya UPM kisaba wabeewo okulonda okulala ng'omwezi gwa Ddesemba guweddeko.

translation.en: 10 lists of malpractices by the same movement were published in The Independent on July 23 - 29, 2010.
translation.lug: Ebikolwa 10 eby'obumenyi bwa mateeka ebyakolebwa ekibiina ekyo byafulumira mu lupapula lwa Independent nga Jjulaayi 23 - 29, 2010.

translation.en: How does one explain the nomination of a Uganda People's Congress candidate who cannot construct a sentence in English and disqualify a University lecturer claiming he has no English certificate?
translation.lug: Kisoboka kitya okuba nti baasobola okuyisaawo owa UPC atasobola wadde okumalayo sentensi emu ey'Olungereza naye ate ne basazaamu omusomesa wa yunivasite nga bagamba satifukeeti ya Lungereza?

translation.en: The Chairman of the Military Commission has not seen it fit to compel the display of registers as provided for by law because Uganda People's Congress does not need it.
translation.lug: Ssentebe wa ekitongole ky'amagye tannalaba bwetaavu bwa kutimba nkalala ng'amateeka bwe geetaagisa kubanga UPC tennatuuka kuzeetaaga.

translation.en: As a final touch to the manipulation exercise, the Chairman of the Military Commission has unlwafully dismissed the Chief Justice.
translation.lug: Mu kwongera okumenyera ddala amateeka, ssentebe w'ekitongole ky'amagye yasalawo okugoba Ssaabalamuzi mu ngeri emenya amateeka.

translation.en: He replaced him with one whose only visible qualification is his flair for meddling in Uganda People's Congress politics.
translation.lug: Yamusikiza oyo alina ekisaanyizo ekimu kyokka nga kye ky'okweyingiza mu by'obufuzi by'ekibiina kya UPC.

translation.en: It is however hoped that legal ethics will not permit the so called new Chief Justice to take the oath and to accept such an appointment.
translation.lug: Kisuubirwa nti amateeka agafuga bannamateeka tegajja kukkiriza Ssabalamuzi oyo omupya kulayizibwa na kukkiriza ofiisi eyo.

translation.en: The Uganda People's Congress, led by Dr. Obote, the creator of Amin, is clamouring for a mandate from the people to form a government for the country.
translation.lug: Ekibiina kya UPC ekikulemberwa Dr. Obote, eyatumbula Amin, kisaba abantu okukiwa akakisa kiteekewo gavumenti eneefuga eggwanga.

translation.en: And yet the Uganda People's Congress has, even up to now, failed to form its own party government.
translation.lug: Kyokka n'okutuusa leero, UPC ekyalemeddwa okulonda abantu abanaakola gavumenti yaayo.

translation.en: The reason is fear of democracy within Uganda People's Congress itself as a party and the desire to install a one man dictatorship.
translation.lug: Ensonga eri nti mu UPC mwennyini batya enkola ya demokulasiya era baagaala okuteekawo gavumenti efugibwa nnakyemalira.

translation.en: This is a flagrant violation of Article 7 of the Uganda People's Congress constitution.
translation.lug: Ekyo kiba kimenya akawayiro 7 aka ssemateeka wa UPC.

translation.en: Murders and other forms of harassment are now daily occurrences.
translation.lug: Ettemu n'okutulugunya abantu kati bifuuse bya bulijjo.

translation.en: As recently as last week, a Democratic Party candidate in Kasese was murdered and although those who were implicated in the murder are known, they are still at large free.
translation.lug: Mu wiiki ewedde, kandidenti wa DP e Kasese yattibwa, era wadde ng'abamutta bamanyiddwa tebakwatibwanga.

translation.en: Elections cannot be free and fair while one is in the grave and his murderer,a Uganda People's Congress candidate, is going to become a Honourable Member of Parliament.
translation.lug: Okulonda tekusobola kuba kwa mazima na bwenkanya ng'omu ku beesimbyewo ali mu ttaka, ate ng'eyamutta, kandidenti wa UPC, agenda kufuuka memba wa paliyamenti.

translation.en: The world in general and Uganda in particular must be informed that all our requests and petitions are to the Chairman of the Military Commission and to the Electoral Commission.
translation.lug: Okutwalira awamu ensi yonna, nnaddala Uganda erina okumanyisibwa nti ebyo byonna bye twasaba twabitegeeza Ssentebe w'ekitongole ky'amagye n'ekitongole ky'eby'okulonda.

translation.en: No single instance can be cited which would show that we sought advantage for our Movement to the disadvantage of other parties.
translation.lug: Tewali asobola kuwa bujulizi bulaga nti twanyigiriza ebibiina ebirala okusobola okuyisaawo ebigendererwa by'ekibiina kyaffe.

translation.en: We wish further to inform the world in general and Uganda in particular that our Movement has borne some extraordinary instances.
translation.lug: Twagala okutegeeza ensi yonna okutwalira awamu nnaddala Uganda nti ekibiina kyaffe kirina ebintu ebimu ebitali bya bulijjo bye kikoze.

translation.en: We therefore call upon whoever will be in authority after 10th December 1980 to immediately set in mortion a process aimed at achieving this objective.
translation.lug: N'olwensonga eyo tukubiriza oyo yenna anaaba mu buyinza oluvannyuma lwa Ddesemba 10 1980 okuteekawo amangu enkola eneesobozesa ekigendererwa ekyo okutuukibwako.

translation.en: The situation today just like Uganda Patriotic Movement, was accusing the ruling Military Commission of refusing to reconstitute the Electoral Commission to accommodate representatives of other parties.
translation.lug: Embeera eriwo leero eringa eyo eyaliwo ng'ekibiina kya UPM kivunaana ekitongole ky'amagye ekyali kifuga olw'okugaana okussaawo ekitongole ky'eby'okulonda ekitalina kyekubiira mu bibiina by'obufuzi.

translation.en: The opposition today is also making similar accusations and demands and the National Resistance Movement is giving exactly the same answers as the Military Commission in 1980.
translation.lug: Ab'oludda oluvuganya gavumenti nabo leero balumiriza era basaba ebintu bye bimu era gavumenti ya NRM by'eyogera bifaanana n'ebyo ekitongole ky'amagye bye kyayogera mu 1980.

translation.en: This was when the Uganda Patriotic Movement protested the Electroral Commission composition.
translation.lug: Ekyo kye kiseera aba UPM lwe beemulugunya ku bakungu b'ekitongole ky'eby'okulonda.

translation.en: The opposition is accusing the current Electoral Commission of being incompetent and too partisan to organise free and fair 2011 general elections.
translation.lug: Ab'oludda oluvuganya gavumenti balumiriza ekitongole ky'eby'okulonda ekiriwo kati olw'okuba ne kyekubiira n'olw'okulemererwa okutegeka okulonda okwa mazima n'obwenkanya okwa 2011.

translation.en: For that reason, they demand that the Electoral Commission be reconstituted to have all political parties represented.
translation.lug: Olw'ensonga eyo, basaba ekitongole ky'eby'okulonda kikolebwemu enkyukakyuka nga kirimu abakiise okuva mu bibiina byonna.

translation.en: But President Museveni has flatly rejected the proposals the way the Military Commission rejected his similar demands in 1980.
translation.lug: Naye ekyo Pulezidenti Museveni yakigaana nga gavumenti eyali mu buyinza mu 1980 bwe yakola.

translation.en: They claimed the Electoral Commission is composed of competent people of high integrity and that there will be no change in its membership in 1980.
translation.lug: Baagamba nti ekitongole ky'eby'okulonda kyalimu abantu abalina obusobozi era abeerufu era kyali tekyetaagisa kukolebwamu nkyukakyuka mu 1980.

translation.en: The opposition is facing media black out instigated by the ruling National Resistance Movement.
translation.lug: Ekibiina kya NRM ekiri mu buyinza kiremesa ab'oludda oluvuganya gavumenti okwogerwako ku mikutu gy'empuliziganya.

translation.en: That also happened during the ruling of Military Commission to the Uganda Patriotic Movement and other opposition parties in 1980.
translation.lug: Ekyo kyennyini ekibiina ekyali mu buyinza mu 1980 kye kyakola ekibiina kya UPM n'ebibiina ebirala ebyali bivuganya gavumenti.

translation.en: The Uganda Patriotic Movement and National Resistance Movement complained of harassment by the security in 1980, the same thing it is visiting upon the opposition today.
translation.lug: Aba UPM n'aba NRM beemulugunya nti baali batulugunyizibwa ab'eby'okwerinda mu 1980, era ekyo kye kimu ekituuse ku b'oludda oluvuganya gavumenti leero.

translation.en: The Uganda People's Movement and National Resistance Movement accused the government of Uganda and National Liberation Army of trolling the city at night, pulling down posters of the opposition parties.
translation.lug: Aba UPM n'aba NRM baalumiriza gavumenti ya Uganda n'eggye lya National Liberation Army okulawuna ekibuga ekiro nga bagenda batimbulula ebipande by'ab'oludda oluvuganya gavumenti.

translation.en: They went ahead and posted campaign materials of Uganda People's Congress.
translation.lug: Baatimbanga bipande bya UPC.

translation.en: The same thing has happened in all the previous elections under the National Resistance Movement.
translation.lug: Ekyo kyennyini kye kibaddewo mu kulonda kwonna okubaddewo wansi wa gavumenti ya NRM.

translation.en: Armed security personnel have pulled down campaign posters of the opposition candidates especially of Kizza Besigye around the city at night and hung posters of National Resistance Movement.
translation.lug: Abasirikale batimbuludde ebipande by'ab'oludda oluvuganya nnaddala ebya  Kizza Besigye mu kibuga ekiro ne batimba ebya NRM.

translation.en: After losing to President Museveni in 2001 and 2006, the Forum for Democratic Change president Dr. Besigye challenged the outcome of the presidential elections in court following alleged rigging.
translation.lug: Oluvannyuma lw'okuwangulwa Pulezidenti Museveni mu 2001 ne mu 2006, pulezidenti wa FDC Dr. Besigye yawakanya ebyava mu kulonda ng'agamba nti mwalimu okubba obululu.

translation.en: In his petition, Dr. Besigye accused the Electoral Commission of mismanaging the electoral process and cited examples.
translation.lug: Mu kuwaba kwe, Dr. Besigye yalumiriza ekitongole ky'eby'okulonda nti kyalemererwa okuddukanya obulungi eby'okulonda era n'awa n'ebyokulabirako.

translation.en: In both petitions in 2001 and 2006, the Supreme Court ruled that the elections were rigged and that the Electoral Commission failed to comply with the electoral law.
translation.lug: Mu 2001 ne mu 2006, Kkooti Ensukulumu yasalawo nti okulonda kwalimu okubba era nti ekitongole ky'eby'okulonda kyalemererwa okugobererwa amateeka agafuga okulonda.

translation.en: But the court declined to annul the elections saying the final result was not affected in a substantial manner.
translation.lug: Naye kkooti yagaana okusazzaamu ebyava mu kulonda ng'egamba nti tebyakosebwa nnyo.

translation.en: By petitioning the Supreme Court, Dr. Besigye was seeking fresh elections, just like Museveni’s party in 1980 was calling for the same.
translation.lug: Mu kuwaayo okusaba kwe mu kkooti ensukulumu, Dr. Besigye yali ayagala okulonda kuddibwemu, ng'era ekibiina kya Museveni bwe kyali kyagala mu 1980.

translation.en: The only difference is that Museveni did not go to court.
translation.lug: Enjawulo yokka eriwo eri nti Museveni teyagenda mu kkooti.

translation.en: He later decided to go to the bush to launch a rebellion.
translation.lug: Oluvannyuma yasalawo kugenda mu nsiko okuyeekera gavumenti.

translation.en: The situation of the opposition in 1980 seems nearly the same today.
translation.lug: Embeera y'ab'oludda oluvuganya gavumenti mu1980 efaananako n'eyo eriwo leero.

translation.en: Museveni’s party complained of being denied access to the media at the instigation of the state.
translation.lug: Ekibiina kya Museveni kyemulugunya nti gavumenti yali ekiremesa okukozesa emikutu gy'empuliziganya.

translation.en: Today, many media houses especially radios and Televisions have denied opposition candidates especially Besigye, space on their airwaves upon getting “orders from above” not to host him.
translation.lug: Leero, emikutu gy'empuliziganya mingi nnaddala leediyo ne TV gigaana okuwa olukusa ab'oludda oluvuganya nnaddala Besigye okugikozesa nga gigamba nti gifunye “ebiragiro okuva eri gavumenti."

translation.en: The state harassment of the opposition of 1980 seems to be replicating itself today nearly in the same form and substance.
translation.lug: Engeri gavumenti gy'etulugunyamu ab'oludda oluvuganya gavumenti efaanana n'engeri gavumenti gye yatulugunyaamu ab'oludda oluvuganya mu 1980.

translation.en: The Independent, July 23 - 29, 2010 By Mubatsi Asinja Habati at 10:30 a.m.
translation.lug: Olupapula lwa Independent, Jjlaayi 23 - 29, 2010 byawandikibwa Mubatsi Asinja Habati ku ssaawa 4:30 ez'oku makya.

translation.en: Samuel Bukawa, 57, is waiting at the National Social Security Fund reception to meet the officer in charge of saver benefits.
translation.lug: Samuel Bukawa, 57, alindirira mu kifo awatuukirwa abagenyi ku NSSF asobole okulaba oyo akola ku ssente eziterekebwa.

translation.en: Sitting on the blue-cushioned reception chairs, Bukawa, is anxious to get his hands on his 16-year-old savings.
translation.lug: Bukawa atudde ku ntebe mu kifo awatuukirwa abagenyi nga yeesunga okufuna ssente z'amaze emyaka 16 ng'atereka.

translation.en: As more people stream through the National Social Security Fund office, Bukawa, who has now been waiting for over 20 minutes, looks at me uneasily like he wants to quarrel.
translation.lug: Ng'abantu beeyongera okuyingira mu ofiisi ya NSSF, Bukawa, amaze eddakiika ezisukka mu 20 ng'alindirira, antunulira ng'alinga ayagala okuyomba.

translation.en: In the National Social Security Fund Act, workers who save with the same are entitled to benefits if they are 50 years old, permanently incapacitated, or leaving the country permanently.
translation.lug: Okusinziira ku mateeka ga NSSF, abakozi abaterekayo ssente bagwana okuweebwa ssente zaabwe singa baba baweza emyaka 50, nga bafunye obulemu obw'olubeerera, oba nga bagenda okuva mu ggwanga lubeerera.

translation.en: Benefits can also be claimed by a dead client’s relatives if the deceased had supported them financially.
translation.lug: Omuntu asobola okusaba ssente z'ow'enganda ze eyafa bw'aba nga ye yali abalabirira.

translation.en: However, for the last three years, Bukawa has been incapable of receiving any of the 30 million shillings he has saved with National Social Security Fund.
translation.lug: Kyokka, okumala emyaka 3, Bukawa tasobodde kufuna ku ssente obukadde 30 z'amaze ebbanga ng'atereka mu kitongole kya NSSF.

translation.en: Today, he is no longer gainfully employed but still has the burden to provide for nine dependants.
translation.lug: Leero, talina mulimu gumusasula bulungi ssente naye alina abantu mwenda ab'okulabirira.

translation.en: On July 7, the committee of parliament on Statutory Authorities and State Enterprises, probed the National Social Security Fund for mismanagement.
translation.lug: Nga Jjulaayi 7, akakiiko ka paliyamenti kaakunya ekitongole kya NSSF olw'okubulankanya ssente z'abantu.

translation.en: It was found out that by 2007 the National Socail Security Fund had lost hundreds of millions of shillings to a fraudulent racket masterminded by employees faking beneficiary claims.
translation.lug: Kyazuulibwa nti nga 2007 ekitongole kya NSSF kyafiirwa obukadde bwa ssente obuwerako olw'abakozi baakyo okugingirira ebiwandiiko ne bafuna ssente mu lukujjukujju.

translation.en: Between December 2007 and August 2008 National Social Security Fund hired Freddie Egesa, a private investigator heading the Global Equity Services Uganda Limited.
translation.lug: Wakkati wa Ddesemba 2007 ne Agusito 2008 NSSF yapangisa Freddie Egesa, omunoonyereza akulira ekitongole ky'obwannannyini ekya Global Equity Services Uganda Limited.

translation.en: Egesa discovered that the fund was losing 200 million Shillings every 90 days to the scam.
translation.lug: Egesa yakizuula nti ekitongole kya NSSf kyali kibbibwa ssente obukadde 200 buli luvannyuma lw'ennaku 90.

translation.en: He explained that National Social Security Fund employees were faking claims in the names of some beneficiaries, processing the cheques and cashing them.
translation.lug: Yagamba nti abakozi ba NSSF baali bagingirira ebiwandiiko mu mannya g'abantu abamu be baasasulanga ssente.

translation.en: After his 8 month investigation, Egesa testified in front of the Statutory Authorities and State Enterprises committee.
translation.lug: Oluvannyuma lw'okunoonyereza okumala emyezi 8, Egesa yawa obujulizi ku bye yali azudde.

translation.en: He said that he had discovered that the unscrupulous National Social Security Fund employees had generated unclaimed beneficiary cheques to a tune of 800 million shillings.
translation.lug: Yagamba nti yakizuula nti abakozi ba NSSF baali bagingiridde ebiwandiiko eby'okusasulirako abantu ssente eziwerera ddala obukadde 800.

translation.en: “These had become stale as the staff in the racket has failed to bank them,” Egesa said.
translation.lug: Egesa yagamba nti, “Ssente ezo zeesiba abakozi abo bwe baalemererwa okuzisa mu bbanka."

translation.en: Set up in 1967, National Social Security Fund is the only social security provider for workers in the private sector and Non-Government Organisations.
translation.lug: Ekitongole kya NSSF ekyateekebwawo mu 1967, kye kitongole kyokka ekitereka ssente z'abakozi abatali ba gavumenti.

translation.en: This is because workers in the private sector and Non-Governemental Organisations are not covered under the Uganda Government Pension Scheme.
translation.lug: Ekyo kiri kityo kubanga abakozi abatali ba gavumenti tebafuna pensoni.

translation.en: If a new law which is being debated under the Uganda Retirement Benefits Regulatory Bill 2010, is passed, workers will for the first time in Uganda have a choice.
translation.lug: Singa etteeka erikwata ku bakozi abaawummula okufuna ssente erikubaganyizibwako ebirowoozo riyisibwa, guno gwe gujja okuba omulundi ogusooka mu Uganda abakozi okufuna eddembe ly'okwesalirawo.

translation.en: Workers can either save with the National Social Security Fund, a government statutory body, or any private pension scheme.
translation.lug: Abakozi bajja kuba basobola okusalawo okutereka ssente mu NSSF, ekitongole kya gavumenti, oba mu kitongole ky'obwannannyini.

translation.en: The bill was approved by cabinet in December 2009 and is awaiting debate in parliament.
translation.lug: Kaabineeti yasemba etteeka eryo mu Ddesemba 2009 era lirindirirwa kukubaganyizibwako birowoozo mu paliyamenti.

translation.en: It seeks to break the monopoly of National Social Security Fund by spurring competition, hopes to improve the quality of service in the retirement benefits industry and pensions sector.
translation.lug: Lyakuyamba mu kuleetawo ebitongole ebirala ebivuganya n'ekitongole kya NSSF kibe nga si kye kyokka ekitereka ssente z'abakozi, ekijja okutumbula obuweereza obuweebwa abakozi abaawummula.

translation.en: The Bill also calls for an independent regulatory authority that will regulate the establishment, management and operation of retirement benefit schemes in the country.
translation.lug: Etteeka eryo era lyetaagisa wassibwewo ekitongole ekitalina kyekubiira okukakasa nti ssente z'abakozi zikwatibwa bulungi mu ggwanga.

translation.en: In the recent years, the National Social Security Fund has been saving the workers' savings, with no political interferance and with better service due to competion.
translation.lug: Ensangi zino, ekitongole kya NSSF kitereka bulungi ssente z'abakozi awatali kuyingirirwa bannabyabufuzi era kituusa obuweereza obulungi ku bantu olw'okuvuganya okwajjawo.

translation.en: The regulating authority will oversee both the public and private retirement benefits and pension providers.
translation.lug: Ekitongole ekyo kijja kuba kirabirira ebitongole bya gavumenti n'eby'obwannannyini ebikola ku pensoni.

translation.en: The bill requires pension providers to have a prudent investment policy and to pay out high rates of return to the savers.
translation.lug: Etteekaa lyetaagisa ebitongole ebigaba pensoni okuba n'ekitongole ekikola okunoonyereza n'okuwa abo ababiterekamu ssente amagoba agawerako.

translation.en: It bars speculative investment of the savings except if they are invested in securities, or in a bank.
translation.lug: Likugira eky'okussa ssente mu bintu ebitakakasibwa okuggyako okuzissa mu bintu gamba nga bbanka.

translation.en: A person who wants to establish a retirement benefits scheme has to apply for a licence upon payment of a fee.
translation.lug: Omuntu ayagala okussaawo ekitongole ekitereka ssente z'abakozi alina omutemwa gwa ssente z'alina okusooka okuwaayo nga tannaweebwa layisinsi.

translation.en: Existing providers regulated by the Capital Market Authority will have to obtain new licences.
translation.lug: Ebitongole ebiriwo ebifugibwa Capital Market Authority nabyo bijja kwetaaga okufuna layisinsi empya.

translation.en: The new pension reforms are expected to be operational in 2011.
translation.lug: Enkyukakyuza empya ezikwata ku pensoni zijja kutandika okukola mu 2011.

translation.en: On July 23 - 29, 2010, The Independent published an analysis on how the new bill will transform the pension sector.
translation.lug: Nga Jjulaayi 23 - 29, 2010, olupapula lwa Independent lwafulumya okunoonyereza okulaga engeri etteeka epya gye linaakwata ku bitongole ebitereka ssente z'abakozi.

translation.en: The Finance Minister Syda Bbumba at the inauguration of the new National Social Security Fund board in October last year said inefficiencies had prevented it from offering quality services.
translation.lug: Bwe yali atongoza akakiiko ka NSSF akapya omwaka oguwedde, minisita w'eby'ensimbi Syda Bbumba yagamba nti obutakola bulungi mirimu gyakyo kyali kiremessezza ekitongole ekyo okuwa abantu empeereza ey'omutindo.

translation.en: She said cabinet had recommended the streamlining of the regulatory framework for the pensions sector and argued the entry of other players in the sector.
translation.lug: Yagamba nti kabineeti yasemba eky'okulambika obulungi entambuza y'emirimu mu bitongole ebitereka ssente z'abakozi n'okukkiriza ebitongole ebirala okukola omulimu ogwo.

translation.en: She added that this would not spell doom for National Social Security Fund unless the management fails to follow good practice.
translation.lug: Yagattako nti ekyo kyali tekijja kusuula kitongole kya NSSF mu buzibu okuggyako ng'abakikulira balemeddwa okukola ekibasuubirwamu.

translation.en: With a liberalised pension sector, employees and employers will be free to choose their pension providers and it should enable workers to benefit and have reasonable interest on their savings.
translation.lug: Enkyukakyuka ezo zijja kuwa abakozi n'ababakozesa akakisa okwesalirawo kitongole ki ekinaabaterekera ssente zaabwe era kijja kusobozesa abakozi okuganyulwa mu ssente ze batereka n'okuzifunamu amagoba.

translation.en: Various service providers for individual retirement schemes will also be opened and it will be the job of their trustees, custodians and administrators to ensure that the scheme operates optimally.
translation.lug: Ebitongole ebirala nabyo bijja kukkirizibwa okutereka ssente z'abakozi era kijja kuba eri ababiddukanya n'abalala ababivunaanyizibwako okukakasa  nti bikola bulungi emirimu gyabyo.

translation.en: “The proposed liberalisation of Uganda’s pension sector is a welcome gesture,” says Ibrahim Okumu, an economist with Makerere University’s Faculty of Economics and Management.
translation.lug: Ibrahim Okumu, omukugu mu by'enfuna mu yunivasite y'e Makerere, agamba nti, “Okukkiriza n'ebitongole ebirala okutereka ssente z'abakozi kirungi nnyo.”.

translation.en: “It’s likely to bring on board more competitive investors in our capital market." Ibrahim Okumu added.
translation.lug: Ibrahim Okumu yagattako nti, “Kijja kuleeta ba invesita abalala abanaaleetawo okuvuganya okusingako ."

translation.en: Uganda’s capital market, he adds, in certain ways, depends on the number of investors willing to hold long term liabilities.
translation.lug: Akatale k'eby'ensimbi mu Uganda okusingira ddala kasinziira ku muwendo gwa ba invesita abeetegefu okuteresebwa ssente okumala ebbanga ddene.

translation.en: “As is now, it is largely the National Social Security Fund that can hold long term liabilities and consequently invest long term liabilities." he continued.
translation.lug: Yeeyongera n'agamba nti, “Mu kiseera kino, ekitongole kya NSSF kye kyokka ekisobola okutereka ssente z'abantu okumala ebbanga ddene n'okuzissa mu bizineesi ezikola amagoba."

translation.en: "This would not only avail more funds for investment but also would enhance Uganda’s growth process." he added.
translation.lug: Yagattako nti, "Kino tekijja kukoma ku kwongera ku ssente ezisobola okuteekebwa mu bizineesi naye era kijja kwongera ku nkulaakulana ya Uganda."

translation.en: Okumu believes that National Social Security Fund’s service, evidenced by the low interest rates it has been paying towards workers' savings, is expected to vanish as competition sets in.
translation.lug: Okumu alowooza nti enkola ya NSSF ey'okuwa abakozi amagoba amatono ku ssente zaabwe, ejja kukyuka olw'okuvuganya okugenda okujjawo.

translation.en: “The elimination of the National Social Security Fund monopoly by liberalising the pension sector signals enhanced competition among pension service providers in a bid to attract many,” he says.
translation.lug: Agamba nti, “Okuleetera NSSF okulekera awo okwefuga akatale kijja kuleetawo okuvuganya okw'amaanyi mu bitongole ebiteresi bya ssente z'abakozi ekijja okutumbula empeereza era kisikirize abakozi bangi okutereka ssente zaabwe mu bitongole ebyo.”

translation.en: “Therefore, we expect enhanced investment analysis before pension funds are invested and consequently better interest rates on workers savings" Okumu continued.
translation.lug: Okumu yeeyongera n'agamba nti, “Tusuubira nti kati wajja kubaawo okwegendereza nga ssente tezinnateekebwa mu kintu kyonna ekizza amagoba era nti abakozi bajja kufuna amagoba agasingako ku ssente zaabwe ze bateresezza."

translation.en: However, Kiwanuka Kunsa, a consultant in the pension investment, says liberalisation in the sector is a welcome point but there are still concerns about how it will be implemented.
translation.lug: Kyokka, Kiwanuka Kunsa, eyeebuuzibwako mu nsonga z'ebitongole ebiteresi bya ssente z'abakozi, agamba nti enkola eno empya eyaniriziddwa naye wakyaliwo ebyebuuzibwa ku ngeri gy'eneetambulamu .

translation.en: At one time it represented a testament to Uganda’s reputation as one of the most refugee friendly countries in Africa.
translation.lug: Olumu kyali kitwalibwa ng'obukakafu obulabwako obulaga nti Uganda efaayo nnyo ku banoonyi b'obubudamo.

translation.en: But recent events at Nakivale and Kyaka camps threaten to erode this reputation.
translation.lug: Naye kati ebyo ebyali mu nkambi y'e Nakivale n'ey'e Kyaka biyinza okuwa ekifaananyi ekirala ku Uganda.

translation.en: On July 14, Ugandan police, working in tandem with Rwandan authorities, used false information to round up and forcibly deport approximately 2,000 Rwandan refugees.
translation.lug: Nga Jjulaayi 14, ekitongole kya poliisi mu Ugandan nga kikolera wamu n'ab'obuyinza mu Rwanda beekwasa ensonga ezitaali ntuufu ne bakwata Abanyarwanda abanoonyi b'obubudamo nga 2,000 era ne babazzaayo ku kifuba mu nsi yaabwe.

translation.en: The operation, which was decried by the United Nations High Commission for Refugees and human rights organizations, left two refugees dead and another 26 injured.
translation.lug: Ekikwekweto ekyo, ekyavumirirwa ennyo ekitongole ky'ensi yonna ekikola ku banoonyi b'obubudamu n'abalwanirizi b'eddembe ly'obuntu , byaleka abanoonyi b'obubudamo babiri nga bafudde ate abalala 26 ne bagendera ku bisago.

translation.en: These refugees were attempting to leap off the trucks hauling them across the border to Rwanda.
translation.lug: Abanoonyi b'obubudamo abo baali bagezaako okubuuka ku loole eyali ebasaza ensalo okubazzaayo e Rwanda.

translation.en: On Wednesday morning an unusually large Ugandan police contingent flanked by Rwandese officers surrounded the two camps.
translation.lug: Ku Lwokusatu kumakya, abasirikale ba poliisi bangi nga bali wamu n'abasirikale ba Rwanda beebungulula enkambi ezo ebbiri.

translation.en: These Rwandese officers lured refugees to assembly points with false promises of food and information on appeals processes.
translation.lug: Abasirikale ba Rwanda abo baasendasenda abanoonyi b'obubudamo okukungaana nga babalimba nti bagenda kubawa mmere n'okubalambululira engeri gye bayinza okujuliramu.

translation.en: Warning shots were fired when the refugees refused to cooperate with the police trying to load them onto Rwanda bound trucks.
translation.lug: Amasasi gaakubwa mu bbanga okulabula abanoonyi b'obubudamo abaali bagaanye okulinnya loole ezibazzaayo e Rwanda  nga poliisi bwe yali ebalagidde.

translation.en: The 2,000 refugees are currently being held in transit centres on the Rwandan side of the border.
translation.lug: Abanoonyi b'obubudamu 2,000 kati bakuumirwa mu bifo ebitali bya nkalakkalira mu Rwanda.

translation.en: The 26 injured remain in Uganda at health clinics around Nakivale.
translation.lug: Ate abo 26 abaafuna ebisago bakyali mu Uganda era bajjanjjabirwa mu bulwaliro obuli okumpi ne Nakivale.

translation.en: Over the last three years, the Rwandan government has intensified efforts to have Rwandan refugees in neighbouring countries, including Uganda and Tanzania, repatriated.
translation.lug: Mu myaka esatu egiyise, gavumenti ya Rwanda eyongedde amaanyi mu kuggya abanoonyi b'obubudamo Abanyarwanda mu mawanga agali ku muliraano omuli Uganda ne Tanzania, bazzibweyo e Rwanda.

translation.en: On October 3, 2007, the first major forced repatriation operation was launched when 3,000 Rwandan refugees were returned to their country of citizenship.
translation.lug: Ekikwekweto eky'amaanyi ekyasooka okukolebwa okuzzaayo ku mpaka abanoonyi b'obubudamu mu nsi yaabwe kyakolebwa nga Okitobba 3, 2007, abanoonyi b'obubudamo 3,000 Abanyarwanda bwe bazzibwayo mu nsi yaabwe.

translation.en: The operation was carried out by police and armed personnel who stormed refugee huts at 2:00 am under the observation of United Nations refugee agency.
translation.lug: Ekikwekweto ekyo kyakolebwa poliisi n'abantu abalala abaalina eby'okulwanyisa abaazingako obusiisira bw'abanoonyi b'obubudamo ku ssaawa 8:00 ez'ekiro ng'ekitongole ky'ensi yonna ekikola ku nsonga z'abanoonyi b'obubudamu kiraba.

translation.en: According to the Legal Officer at the Refugee Law Project, Salima Namusobya, such operations are a one off and they are coordinated between the governments of Rwanda and Uganda.
translation.lug: Okusinziira ku mukungu omu akola ku nsonga z'abanoonyi b'obubudamo, Salima Namusobya, yagamba nti ebikwekweto ng'ebyo tebitera kubaawo era nti bikolebwa gavumenti ya Rwanda ng'ekolagana wamu n'eya Uganda.

translation.en: Over the years, United Nations High Commission for Refugees has held numerous meetings with Ugandan and Rwandan authorities on the repatriation of Rwandan refugees.
translation.lug: Emyaka bwe gizze gitambula, ekibiina ekikola ku nsonga z'abanoonyi b'obubudamu mu nsi yonna kibadde kifuna enkungaana n'ab'obuyinza mu Ugandan ne Rwanda ku nsonga z'okuzzaayo Abanyarwanda mu nsi yaabwe.

translation.en: In Rwanda, the refugees are held at transit centres, but once they are released from these temporary holding areas, many of them will find their way back to Uganda.
translation.lug: Mu Rwanda, abanoonyi b'obubudamo bakuumirwa mu bifo ebimu okumala akaseera katono naye nga bwe bamala okuteebwa era banoonya engeri gye baddayo e Uganda.

translation.en: "Unwanted guests," the Rwandan refugees, are forced back across the border towards Kyangwali refugee camp near Hoima town.
translation.lug: Olw'okuba baba tebakyabaagala, abanoonyi b'obubudamo abo babazzaayo misinde nga bayitira ku nsalo eri okumpi n'enkambi y'e Kyangwali okumpi n'akabuga k'e Hoima.

translation.en: In a courtesy Photo, featured in  The Independent on July 23 - 29, 2010, it was said that, upon return,the refugees are far less likely to make themselves known to the Ugandan government.
translation.lug: Mu kifaananyi ekimu ekyafulumira mu lupapula lwa Independent olwa Jjulaayi 23 - 29, 2010, kyagambibwa nti abanoonyi b'obubudamu bwe bakomawo e Uganda tebeemanyisa eri ba buyinza mu Uganda.

translation.en: They will also not make themselves known to United Nations High Commission for Refugees but will instead quietly disappear into the villages surrounding the camps in south western Uganda.
translation.lug: Era tebeemanyisa eri kitongole ekikola ku nsonga z'abanoonyi b'obubudamu mu nsi yonna, mu kifo ky'ekyo babulira mu byalo ebiriranye enkabi ezo mu bugwanjuba bwa Uganda.

translation.en: “Most of the refugees they took back in 2007 have come back,” says Nabusobya.
translation.lug: Nabusobya agamba nti, “Abasinga obungi ku banoonyi b'obubudamo abazzibbwayo mu 2007 baakomawo dda.”

translation.en: “Many Rwandans who are taken by force come back and register as Congolese refugees so this doesn’t help any of the countries involved". Nabusobya added.
translation.lug: Nabusobya agattako nti, “Bangi ku Banyarwanda abazzibwayo ku kifuba bakomawo ne beewandiisa ng'abanoonyi b'obubudamo Abakongo era ekyo kiba tekiyambye mawanga gombi gazingirwamu."

translation.en: "Two months ago a bilateral agreement was struck between representatives of the Ugandan and Rwandese governments facilitating the deportation of Rwandese whose requests for asylum had been rejected.
translation.lug: "Emyezi ebiri emabega, gavumenti ya Uganda ne Rwanda zaatuka ku nzikiriziganya ku ngeri y'okukwatamu Abanyarwanda abanoonyi b'obubudamu ababa bagaaniddwa okuddukira mu Uganda.

translation.en: But Kai Nielsen, the United Nations High Commission for Refugees country representative for Uganda, had a concern.
translation.lug: Naye Kai Nielsen, akiikirira ekitongole ky'ensi yonna ekikola ku nsonga z'abanoonyi b'obubudamu mu Uganda, yalina kye yeebuuza.

translation.en: His concern was that among those deported on 14, July were people whose asylum claims had not yet been conclusively rejected.
translation.lug: Abamu ku abo abazzibwayo nga Jjulaayi 14, mwe mwali n'abo abaali batannagaanibwa ddala kufuna bubudamo mu Uganda.

translation.en: Witness testimony from family members at the Ugandan refugee settlements indicate that a number of individuals had already been granted refugee status.
translation.lug: Obujulizi obwaweebwa ab'enganda z'abantu abo mu nkambi bulaga nti baali bakkiriziddwa okubeera mu ggwanga ng'abanoonyi b'obubudamo.

translation.en: However those together with those still involved in the appeal process, were among those forced across the border.
translation.lug: Naye abantu abo awamu n'abo abaali baajulira be bamu ku abo abazzibwayo ku kifuba e Rwanda.

translation.en: Nielsen further stated how unusual it was for Rwandan police to be present on Ugandan soil.
translation.lug: Nielsen era yagamba nti kyewuunyisa nnyo okuba nti poliisi ya Rwanda yajja okukolera emirimu gyayo mu Uganda.

translation.en: The Kigali government has held the position for some time that there is no longer any need for Rwanda’s citizens to claim refugee status anywhere else in the world
translation.lug: Kati okumala ekiseera, gavumenti ya Rwanda ebaddenga egamba nti Abanyarwanda tekikyabeetaagisa kuddukira mu nsi ndala yonna nga banoonyi ba bubudamo.

translation.en: Uganda, while still accepting asylum claims, has rejected 98 per cent of asylum applications from Rwandan citizens in the last year.
translation.lug: Wadde nga Uganda ekyakkiriza abanoonyi b'obubudamo okuyingira eggwanga, mu mwaka oguwedde yagaana Abanyarwanda ebitundu 98 ku buli kikumi okufuna obubudamo mu ggwanga.

translation.en: Many Rwandan refugees came to Uganda fleeing the 1994 genocide, while others have fled Rwanda recently for political reasons.
translation.lug: Abanyarwanda bangi abanoonyi b'obubudamo baava mu Rwanda ne baddukira mu Uganda olw'ekittabantu ekyali mu Rwanda mu 1994, naye kati gye buvuddeko abantu badduka mu Rwanda lwa nsonga za bya bufuzi.

translation.en: The Refugee Law Project has found that most Rwandan refugees are unwilling to go back because of fear of persecution through the Gacaca court system.
translation.lug: Ab'ekitongole kya Refugee Law Project bakizudde nti Abanyarwanda bangi batya okuddayo mu Rwanda olw'okutya okutulugunyizibwa.

translation.en: “These refugees have gone back and have faced persecution, others have problems with property restitution,” said Namusobya.
translation.lug: Namusobya yagamba nti, “Abanoonyi b'obubudamu bano bwe baddayo, batulugunyizibwa, ate abalala tebabaddiza bintu byabwe.”

translation.en: There are reports from those who return saying, people in government occupied their land and refugee agencies in Rwanda are not doing enough to integrate those that are taken back.
translation.lug: Abo abakomawo e Uganda bagamba nti abantu mu gavumenti bezza ettaka lyabwe era nti ebitongole by'abanoonyi b'obubudamo mu Rwanda tebikola kimala kubayamba.

translation.en: Human Rights Watch has indicated that although the Rwandese government has made notable progress in reforming its judicial system since 2004, there is little assurance for free and fair trials.
translation.lug: Ekitongole ekirwanirira eddembe ly'obuntu kigamba nti wadde ng'ekitongole ekiramuzi mu Rwanda kirongoose okusinga bwe kyali mu 2004, tewannabaawo bukakafu bumala bulaga nti omuntu asobola okulamulwa mu mazima n'obwenkanya.

translation.en: There have also been rights violation concerns in Rwanda, including increased insecurity and political repression in the period leading up to presidential elections on August 9.
translation.lug: Ate era wabaddewo okulinnyirira eddembe ly'obuntu mu Rwanda, omuli okutiisatiisa abantu n'okutulugunya bannabyabufuzi naddala mu biseera by'okulonda pulezidenti okwaliwo nga Agusito 9.

translation.en: Nielsen questions Uganda’s cooperation in the forced repatriation.
translation.lug: Nielsen yeebuuza ensonga lwaki Uganda yakolagana ne Rwanda mu kuzzaayo abanoonyi b'obubudamu ku kifuba.

translation.en: “I personally don’t see the reason for being so insistent on returning these people to Rwanda,” he said.
translation.lug: Yagamba nti, “Nze siraba nsonga lwaki bakaka abantu bano okuddayo mu Rwanda.”

translation.en: “I don’t think that they were a security threat or a financial burden to Uganda." he went on to say.
translation.lug: Era yagamba nti, “Sikiwa nti abantu bano baali ba bulabe eri gavumenti ya Uganda oba nti yali tesobola kubalabirira."

translation.en: The Minister for Disaster preparedness Tarsis Kabwegye denies that refugees are being forced home.
translation.lug: Minisita w'ebigwa bitalaze Tarsis Kabwegye yagaana okukkiriza nti abanoonyi b'obubudamo bawalirizibwa okuddayo mu nsi zaabwe.

translation.en: He claimed those taken back were asylum seekers and said that the Rwanda government has a right to come and pick up “their stranded citizens"
translation.lug: Yagamba nti abo abazzibwayo baali badduse lwa nsonga za byabufuzi era nti gavumenti ya Rwanda erina eddembe okujja n'etwala abantu baayo "ababa basobeddwa nga tebamanyi kya kukola"

translation.en: But some of these refugees, according to Namusobya, should qualify for Ugandan citizenship.
translation.lug: Naye ye Namusobya agamba nti abamu ku banoonyi b'obubudamo abo baali bagwana n'okuweebwa obutuuze mu Uganda.

translation.en: Many refugees have lived in the country for more than 20 years and the constitution accepts them and for most Rwandese they even have a local language knowledge addition.
translation.lug: Abanoonyi b'obubudamo bangi bamaze mu Uganda emyaka egisukka mu 20 era ssemateeka abakkiriza okufuna obutuuze, ate era Abanyarwanda abasinga obungi bayizeeyo waakiri olulimi lumu olwogerwa mu Uganda.

translation.en: While the Uganda Refugees Act of 2006 recognizes that naturalisation applies to refugees, the immigration authorities in Uganda have continued to block refugees from acquiring citizenship.
translation.lug: Wadde nga ssemateeka wa Uganda owa 2006 akkiriza abanoonyi b'obubudamu abamaze ebbanga eggere okufuna obutuuze, ekitongole kya Uganda ekikola ku nsonga z'abantu abayingira mu ggwanga kiremesa abanoonyi b'obubudamo okufuna obutuuze.

translation.en: Namusobya said the Refugee Law Project intends to petition the constitutional court to allow refugees who have lived in Uganda for more than 20 years to be allowed citizenship.
translation.lug: Namusobya yagamba nti ekitongole kya Refugee Law Project kiteekateeka okuwaayo okusaba mu kkooti ekkirize abanoonyi b'obubudamo abamaze emyaka egisukka mu 20 mu Uganda okuweebwa obutuuze.

translation.en: Most of these Rwandese have lost touch with their country of origin and so forcing them back ‘home’ cannot be the ultimate solution.
translation.lug: Abasinga obungi ku Bannyarwanda abo tebakyalina kakwate na nsi yaabwe era okubakaka okuddayo kiba tekibayamba n'akamu.

translation.en: Refugees get off a truck at Matanda refugee camp in Kanungu district.
translation.lug: Abanoonyi b'obubuddamu bava ku loole mu nkambi y'e Matanda mu disitulikiti y'e Kanungu.

translation.en: Many refugees forced back to Rwanda return to Uganda claiming they are Congolese.
translation.lug: Abanoonyi b'obubuddamu bangi abazzibwayo e Rwanda ku mpaka bakomawo mu Uganda nga bagamba nti Bakongo.

translation.en: In a courtesy  photo in October 2007, Uganda deported 3,000 Rwandans on a Wednesday night when the authorities raided Kyaka II and Nakivale refugee settlements.
translation.lug: Ekifaananyi ekyakubibwa mu Okitobba 2007, Uganda yazzaayo Abanyarwanda 3,000 e Rwanda mu kiro ky'Olwokusatu ab'obuyinza bwe baazingako enkambi y'e Kyaka II n'ey'e Nakivale.

translation.en: On that night, thousands of Rwandan nationals were violently driven out of those settlements.
translation.lug: Mu kiro ekyo, Abanyarwanda nkumi na nkumi baagobebwa mu nkambi ezo mu ngeri ey'obukambwe.

translation.en: A witness told reporters that the refugees were loaded onto four Fuso trucks and forcibly expelled late at night.
translation.lug: Eyeerabirako n'agage yagamba bannamawulire nti abanoonyi b'obubuddamu baateekebwa ku Fuso nnya ne bakakibwa okugenda amatumbi budde.

translation.en: There were protests against the violation of the United Nations principle of non refoulemnt or involuntary return of people to a country they fled.
translation.lug: Abantu beekalakaasa nga bawakanya eky'okumenya etteeka ery'Amawanga Amagatte erigaana okukkakka abantu okuddayo mu ggwanga lye baddukamu.

translation.en: At the time United Nations High Commission for Refugees agreed with the governments of Rwanda and Uganda claims that return had been 'voluntary'.
translation.lug: Mu kiseera ekyo, ekitongole ky'ensi yonna ekikola ku nsonga z'abanoonyi b'obubudamo kyakkiriza ebyo gavumenti ya Rwanda ne Uganda ze byakigamba nti abantu abo baddayo 'kyeyagalire'.

translation.en: There were reported cases of refugees who tried to commit suicide by taking a cattle dip acaricide in trying to resist the repatriation.
translation.lug: Kigambibwa nti waaliwo n'abanoonyi b'obubuddamu abamu abaagezaako n'okwetta nga bakozesa eddagala ly'ente nga baagala okwewala okuzzibwayo e Rwanda.

translation.en: Refugees, some older than 50 years, had been forced to return to Rwanda.
translation.lug: Abanoonyi b'obubuddamu, ng'abamu baali basussa mu myaka 50 egy'obukulu, baakakibwa okuddayo mu Rwanda.

translation.en: Newspaper reports at the time revealed that the affected communities were mainly Rwandese of Hutu origin who had first sought refugee status in Tanzania but were expelled in 2003.
translation.lug: Empapula z'amawulire zaagamba nti ebitundu ebyasinga okukosebwa ennyo by'ebyo ebyalimu Abanyarwanda Abahutu abangi abaasooka okubudamirako e Tanzania naye ne bagobwayo mu 2003.

translation.en: Most Rwandan refugees moved into Uganda after Tanzania began to aggressively return them to Rwanda.
translation.lug: Abanoonyi b'obubuddamu Abanyarwanda abasinga obungi bajja mu Uganda oluvannyuma lwa Tanzania okutandika okubazzaayo e Rwanda n'eryanyi.

translation.en: Over 5,000 refugees moved to Uganda in 2003.
translation.lug: Abanoonyi b'obubuddamu abasukka mu 5,000 bajja mu Uganda mu 2003.

translation.en: The Independent on July 23 - 29, 2010, in a declassified intelligence file by Rowan Emslie had information that on the night of the attack, everyone was in shock.
translation.lug: Olupapula lwa Independent olwa July 23 - 29, 2010, fayiro eyakolebwa Rowan Emslie yalaga nti mu kiro obulumbaganyi obwo lwe bwakolebwa, buli omu yasigala mu ntiisa.

translation.en: I talked to a young couple who had been watching the World Cup Final at The Lion’s Den, a bar immediately opposite Ethiopian Village Restaurant.
translation.lug: Nnayogerako n'omwami n'omukyala omu abaali balabira omupiira ku bbaala eyitibwa The Lion’s Den, eriraanye Ethiopian Village Restaurant.

translation.en: As Kampala slowly moves back towards normalcy, the mood around the city is changing.
translation.lug: Nga Kampala agenda adda mpolampola mu nteeko, enneewulira z'abantu mu kibuga nazo zigenda zikyuka.

translation.en: People are starting to express anger, at either Al Shabaab or the police for not having done enough in preparation, as well as fear.
translation.lug: Abantu banyiivu olwa Al Shabaab okukola ekintu eky'ettima bwe kityo era banyiivu olwa poliisi obutakola kimala kwetegekera bulumbaganyi obwo, era bali mu kutya.

translation.en: In a report by international relations expert John Mueller, he noted that, reactions to terrorism have often led to massive unjustified persecution, some of which is considerable historic consequence.
translation.lug: Mu alipoota gye yakola, omwekenneenya omu ayitibwa John Mueller yagamba nti bwe wabaawo obulumbaganyi bw'abatujju, emirundi egisinga amawanga gakwata era ne gatulugunya abantu abatalina musango, oboolyawo nga basinziira ku byafaayo bye babalinako.

translation.en: The Russian re-engagement with Chechnya in 1999 or Israel’s crackdowns against Palestine are instant examples.
translation.lug: Ebyo ebikwata ku Russia ne Chechnya mu 1999 oba ebyaliwo nga Isirairi enoonya Abapalesitiina bikiraga bulungi.

translation.en: President Museveni’s pledge to send additional 20,000 troops to the African Union peacekeeping mission in Somalia was based on reactionary anger and a show of strength.
translation.lug: Pulezidenti Museveni okusuubiza okusindika abasirikale abalala 20,000 mu Somalia yakyogeza busungu na lwa kwagala kulaga lyanyi.

translation.en: This followed the comments of an Al Shabaab leader who said that the bombings were revenge for Uganda’s deployment of peacekeepers in Mogadishu and was ‘only the beginning’.
translation.lug: Ebyo yabyogera oluvannyuma lw'omu ku bakulembera Al Shabaab okugamba nti obulumbaganyi obwo baabukola kwesasuza Uganda olw'okusindika amagye e Somaliya era nti eyo ntandikwa butandikwa.

translation.en: Mueller is a renowned sceptic of how important terrorists are and has often argued that the relatively low death tolls cannot justify the massive killings seen in a retaliatory war.
translation.lug: Mueller amanyiddwa nnyo mu kunoonyereza ku nsonga za bannalukalala era agamba nti talaba nsonga lwaki okufa kw'abantu abatonotono kuviirako abantu okutta abantu bangi nnyo nga bagezaako okwesasuza.

translation.en: Although some people like to proclaim that this is ‘the age of terror,’ Mueller in ‘Reactions and Overreactions to Terrorism,’ says, “deaths from international terrorism are only a few, annually"
translation.lug: Mu kitabo 'Reactions and Overreactions to Terrorism,’ Mueller agamba nti “wadde ng'abatujju batta abantu, omuwendo gw'abantu be batta buli mwaka mu nsi yonna okutwalira awamu mutono."

translation.en: Two American researchers, Jennifer Merolla and Elizabeth Zechmeister, spent five years researching the reactions of the general public to terrorist threats to see how people change their opinions.
translation.lug: Abanoonyereza babiri okuva mu Amerika, Jennifer Merolla ne Elizabeth Zechmeister, baamala emyaka etaano nga banoonyereza ku ngeri abantu okutwalira awamu gye batwalamu obulumbaganyi bwa bannalukalala era n'engeri abantu gye bakyusaamu endowooza yaabwe.

translation.en: Reports of xenophobic violence since the bombings have been disturbing, especially considering Uganda has a reputation for being an accessible and safe country.
translation.lug: Ebikolwa eby'obukambwe ebikolebwa ku bantu b'eggwanga abatujju mwe baava byeraliikiriza, nnaddala bw'olowooza ku ky'okuba nti Uganda ebadde emanyiddwa ng'ensi omuntu mw'asobola okufunira emirembe.

translation.en: What is perhaps more worrying is the lack of furore after the Ugandan Parliament approved the controversial Phone Tapping Bill last week.
translation.lug: Ate n'ekirala ekisinga okweraliikiriza kiri nti abantu tebaasanyukira tteeka paliyamenti lye yabaga wiiki ewedde erikwata ku kulumika amasimu.

translation.en: Karin Bridger, a videographer and cultural anthropologist working in Uganda said, some people have embraced a ‘keep calm and carry on’ attitude, while others have become more crippled by concern.
translation.lug: Karin Bridger, omukwasi wa vidiyo akolera mu Uganda agamba nti abantu abamu bo basazeewo okuba n'endowooza egamba nti ‘sigala ng'oli mukkakkamu weeyongereyo n'obulamu' ate abalala bo okutya kubassannyalazza.

translation.en: Those who went to work on Monday morning relatively unconcerned, caused consternation with people who were more scared.
translation.lug: Abo abaagenda okukola ku Bbalaza nga  balinga abatafuddeeyo nnyo baasobera abantu abaali bakubiddwa entiisa olw'ekyo ekyali kibaddewo.

translation.en: A lawyer, who asked not to be named said he went to work on the next Monday morning after the attack.
translation.lug: Munnamateeka omu ataayagala kwatuukirizibwa mannya yagamba nti oluvannyuma lw'obulumbaganyi obwo, ye yagenda ku mulimu ku Bbalaza.

translation.en: "Don’t worry too much", says one of those people who were less openly affected by the attacks.
translation.lug: Omu ku bantu ataalemesa bulumbaganyi obwo kumusannyalaza yagamba nti, "Tekyetaagisa kweraliikirira kisukkiridde."

translation.en: There are also stories of an outpouring of anger and fear brought on by relatively minor things, maybe two or three days later.
translation.lug: Era kigambibwa nti wabaawo obusungu n'okutya ebireetebwa ebintu ebitonotono ebiyinza okubaawo ennaku nga bbiri oba ssatu oluvannyuma.

translation.en: A doctor who was called to Mulago,on the night of the blasts, working in frantic conditions at very short notice had this to say.
translation.lug: Omusawo eyayitibwa okugenda e Mulago mu kiro ekyo nga bbomu zaakakuba abantu era eyakolera mu mbeera eyo ey'entiisa yagamba bw'ati.

translation.en: Coping with 7/11 aftermath, Mueller, a renowned sceptic of how important terrorists are, argues that the low death tolls cannot justify the massive loss of life seen in a retaliatory war.
translation.lug: Ng'ayogera ku ngeri y'okwaŋŋanga embeera oluvannyuma lw'obulumbaganyi obwaliwo nga Jjulaayi 11, Mueller, agamba nti talaba nsonga lwaki okufa kw'abantu abatonotono kuviirako abantu okutta abantu bangi nnyo nga bagezaako okwesasuza.

translation.en: In an introduction of an unreferenced memorandum dated 13, October 2008.
translation.lug: Mu nnyanjula y'ekiwandiiko ekyawandiikibwa nga 13, Okitobba 2008.

translation.en: On the 08, October 2008, a meeting comprising of 24 former Allied Democratic Forces reporters led by their former Chief of Staff, Benz Tushabe Munyangondo, was convened.
translation.lug: Nga 08, Okitobba 2008, olukuŋŋaana olwalimu abaaliko abayeekera ba ADF 24 nga bakulembeddwamu eyaliko mukama waabwe, Benz Tushabe Munyangondo, lwatuula.

translation.en: The meeting was also important as a pre-emptive security measure owing to their grievances ahead of the 09, October 2008 Independence Day celebrations.
translation.lug: Olukuŋŋaana olwo era lwategekebwa okwongera okunyweza eby'okwerinda nga batunula mu kwemulugunya kwe baalina, naddala nga bwe kiri nti emikolo gy'amefuga gyali gisembedde nga gya kubaawo nga 09, Okitobba 2008.

translation.en: It was also about the just concluded Tripartite Plus,the Common Market for East and Southern Africa and the Southern Development Community Heads of government summit in Kampala.
translation.lug: Era lwali lukwata ne ku lukuŋŋaana olwalimu abakulembezee b'amawanga ag'enjawulo olwali lwakaggwa olwali mu Kampala.

translation.en: The memorandum was signed by Hussein Maiga and Benz Tushabe on behalf of the group.
translation.lug: Ekiwandiiko ekyo kyassibwako omukono Hussein Maiga ne Benz Tushabe ku lwabannaabwe.

translation.en: That they represent and work on behalf of the many Allied Democratic Forces reporters scattered all over the country having been pardoned under the Amnesty Act of 2000.
translation.lug: Nti bakiikirira era bakolerera bannaabwe abangi abaaliko abayeekera ba ADF abasaasaanidde mu bitundu by'eggwanga ebitali bimu oluvannyuma lw'okuweebwa ekisonyiwo okusinziira ku ssemateeka wa 2000 akwata ku kuwa abantu ekisonyiwo.

translation.en: That it’s over 7 years since the former Allied Democratic Forces combatants voluntarily renounced rebellion against the government by reporting to various stakeholders.
translation.lug: Nti kati wayise emyaka egisukka mu 7 bukya abaaliko abayeekera ba ADF okuva mu buyeekera ne beewaayo mu mikono gya gavumenti n'ebitongole ebirala nga bakakasa nti baleseeyo ebikolwa eby'obuyeekera.

translation.en: These stakeholders included; army units/ detaches, Resident District Commissioner offices, churches and many others.
translation.lug: Mu kwewaayo baatuukirira ebitongole by'amagye, ofiisi za ba RDC, abakulu b'amadiini, n'abalala.

translation.en: That it would be a wrong assumption for the government to think they surrendered because of cowardice or the Uganda People's Defence Forces fire power.
translation.lug: Nti kiba kikyamu gavumenti okulowooza nti beewaayo olw'okuba baali batiitiizi oba olw'okuba eggye lya UPDF lyali lya maanyi.

translation.en: That they have written numerous reports and memorandum highlighting their plight to His Excellence, The President and The Chieftaincy of Military Intelligence.
translation.lug: Nti bawandiise alipoota nnyingi era n'ebiwandiiko ebitali bimu ebirambika embeera gye balimu ne babiwa Ow'ekitiibwa Pulezidenti ne CMI.

translation.en: That the resettlement package given to former Allied Democratic Forces was too small.
translation.lug: Nti ssente ezaaweebwa abo abaaliko abayeekera ba ADF zaali ntono nnyo.

translation.en: Nigeria has reportedly recovered its former president General Sani Abacha’s £3 billion.
translation.lug: Nigeria esobodde okununula pawundi obuwumbi 3 ez'eyaliko pulezidenti wa Nigeria, Genero Sani Abacha.

translation.en: After an agonising 33 hours, Patrick and Beatrice Kirumira Lubowa were relieved to receive the good news that their four year old son King Lubowa, had been recovered safe.
translation.lug: Oluvannyuma lw'okumala essaawa 33 nga beeraliikirivu nnyo, Patrick ne Beatrice Kirumira Lubowa emitima gyabakka bwe baafuna amawulire amalungi nti mutabani waabwe ow'emyaka ena, Kinga Lubowa, yali azuuliddwa nga mulamu.

translation.en: King Lubowa had been kidnapped by Uganda’s Al-Shabaab.
translation.lug: King Lubowa yali awambiddwa aba Al-Shabaab abali mu Uganda.

translation.en: Beatrice Kirumira Luboowa is the daughter of Kampala businessman Godfrey Kirumira.
translation.lug: Beatrice Kirumira Luboowa muwala w'omusuubuzi w'omu Kampala ayitibwa Godfrey Kirumira.

translation.en: King was kidnapped from his parents’ home in Kiwafu-Makindye, a Kampala suburb, on July 24 by a housemaid, Soso Solange.
translation.lug: King yawambibwa omukozi w'awaka ayitibwa Soso Solange okuva mu maka g'abazadde be agasangibwa mu Kiwafu e Makindye, mu Kampala, nga Jjulaayi 24.

translation.en: Swift action by the Uganda police and other security organs traced the kidnappers to a single room house in Makindye.
translation.lug: Poliisi ya Uganda n'ebitongole ebirala ebikuuma ddembe byasitukiramu ne birondoola abo abaamuwamba ne bibasanga mu kayumba ak'omuzigo ogumu e Makindye.

translation.en: King becomes the second child to be kidnapped in just two months after another child Khan Kakama was kidnapped, murdered and dumped in a swamp just last month.
translation.lug: King ye mwana ow'okubiri eyaakawambibwa mu myezi ebiri gyokka oluvannyuma lw'omwana omulala Khan Kakama okuwambibwa n'attibwa era n'asuulibwa mu lutobazi omwezi oguwedde.

translation.en: Last year alone, over 318 children were kidnapped and18 of them were murdered in ritual sacrifice.
translation.lug: Mu mwaka oguwedde gwokka, abaana abasukka mu 318 be baawambibwa ate 18 be battibwa mu mikolo gy'okussaddaaka.

translation.en: In The Independent on  July 30 - August 05 2010, in a news round-up, Yusuf Serunkuma said, the most renowned lines defining terror is that it is a “clash of civilizations".
translation.lug: Mu mawulire ga Independenti aga Jjulaayi nga 13 okutuuka nga Agusto 5, Yusuf Serunkuma yagamba nti "ebigambo okukontana kw'obugunjufu" bye bikyasinze okunnyonnyola ekigambo okutya.

translation.en: ”It was started by Princeton University professor Bernard Lewis in his 1990 article, The Roots of Muslim Rage.
translation.lug: Kino kyatandikibwawo omukenkufu ayitibwa Bernard Lewis ow'omu Princeton Universty mu ebyo bye yawandiika mu 1990, Ensibuko y'Obukambwe bw'Abasiraamu.

translation.en: Most recently, it was expounded by Cable News Network’s Harvard trained political scientist Fareed Zakaria in his book, The Future of Freedom.
translation.lug: Gyebuddeko awo kyannyonnyolebwa munnamawulire era munnabyabufuzi eyatendekebwa mu Yunivasite y'e Harvard ayitibwa Fareed Zakaria, mu kitabo kye ekiyitibwa The Future of Freedom.

translation.en: After the July 11 bomb attacks in Kampala, I have come to fully understand that war is serious business, and more serious when it reaches your house.
translation.lug: Oluvannyuma lwa bbomu ezaatulikira mu Kampala ngaJjulaayi 11, kati nkitegeera bulungi nti olutalo si kintu kya muzannyo era luba lwa kabi nnyo nnaddala nga lutuuse ewuwo.

translation.en: If the July 11 had happened in Mogadishu, it would have passed as a small inconvenience and also maybe as a lead story on Aljazeera Television.
translation.lug: Singa kino ekyaliwo mu Jjulaayi nga 11 kyali Mogadishu, tekyandiwuniikiriza nnyo era tekyandyogeddwako ng'ekintu ekikulu mu mawulire ga Aljazeera,

translation.en: Kampala would be normal business mindless of our large military presence in this coastal country.
translation.lug: Kampala yandibadde kifo kirungi nnyo eky'okukoleramu busineesi singa abasirikale baba tebakyefuze.

translation.en: As it has always been, we would have absent-mindedly asked them when these people will stop fighting.
translation.lug: Nga bwe kibadde bulijjo, twandibadde tumala gababuuza ddi abantu bano lwe banaalera awo okulwanagana.

translation.en: This question is an assumption that fighting groups in Somalia are unintelligent brutes fighting and killing each other without reason.
translation.lug: Mu kubuuza ekibuuzo kino tuba tusuubira nti abo abalwanagana mu Somalia tebalina magezi kubanga balwanagana era ne battiŋŋaana awatali nsonga.

translation.en: It also assumes that increased military intervention in form of peacekeeping missions can help save Somalis from finishing off each other.
translation.lug: Era kitebeerezebwa nti amaggye amagwiira ageeyongera okutwalibwa mu Somaliya okukuuma emirembe gajja kusobola okuyamba Abasomaali obutesanyaawo.

translation.en: This also assumes that foreign nations can help export liberty and other freedoms to Somalia, even if they seem uninterested in them.
translation.lug: Era kitebeerezebwa nti amagye amagwiira gajja kusobola okuleeta emirembe mu Somaliya, wadde nga bo balabika ng'abatafaako.

translation.en: Analyses of the Kampala bombings have become so emotional, as it were in post 9/11 America.
translation.lug: Kinakuwaza nnyo nga bwe kyali oluvannyuma lwa ebyo ebyali mu Amerika nga 9/11 bwe twongera okwekennenya ebyo ebyaliwo bbomu lwe zaatulikira mu Kampala.

translation.en: Hijab covered Muslim girls, and men with long beards or those wearing turbans are now the unfortunate recipients of public rage as the “bad guys”.
translation.lug: Abawala Abasiraamu abeebikirira n'abasajja ab'ebirevu ebiwanvu oba abo abambala ebiremba be boolekezeddwa obwanga nga batwalibwa okuba abantu ababi.

translation.en: In a discussion with a colleague, I asked him what took America to Somalia against the Union of Islamic Courts that tried to give Somalia a resemblance of a government.
translation.lug: Bwe nnali nnyumyako ne mukozi munnange nnamubuuza ekyatwala Abamerika mu Somaliya okulwanyisa ekibiina ky'abasiraamu abali bagezaako okussaawo ekyefaananyiriza okuba gavumenti.

translation.en: The union was trying this out after 14 years of civil war.
translation.lug: Ekibiina ekyo kyali kigezaako okukola kino oluvannyuma lw'emyaka 14 egy'olutalo olw'omunda.

translation.en: His argument was that the Islamic Courts Union had put in place an administration that cherishes stoning the adulterous, amputating thieves and compulsory wearing of full body garments.
translation.lug: Ye yagamba nti ekibiina ky'abasiraamu ekyo kyali kitaddewo enkola ey'okukuba abenzi amayija, okutemako ababbi amagulu n'okuwaliriza abantu okwambala engoye ezibikka omubiri gwonna.

translation.en: Bernard Lewis called this “a clash of civilisation”.
translation.lug: Kino Bernard Lewis yakiyita "okukontana kw'obugunjufu."

translation.en: As Professor Mahmood Mamdani has argued, modern violence is considered the inevitable hallmark of progress.
translation.lug: Omukenkufu Mahmood Mamdana agamba nti, obukambwe obuliwo ensanji zino buteekwa buteekwa kubaawo kubanga ke kabonero akalaga enkulaakulana

translation.en: Israel’s shelling of the Gazans in late 2008 was considered crucial for Israel security, and so is the war in Afghanistan and in Iraq for American safety.
translation.lug: Ekya Abayisirayiri okuwandagaza bbomu ku bantu b'omu Gaza mu 2008, kyatwalibwa okuba ekintu ekikulu ennyo mu by'okwerinda kwa Isirairi, era mu ngeri y'emu olutalo lwa Afiganistani ne Iraka lutwalibwa ng'ekintu ekikulu ennyo mu by'okwerinda kwa Amerika.

translation.en: After the Septemebr 11th incident, frightened Americans considered any Muslim led country, an enemy to progress.
translation.lug: Oluvannyuma lw'ebyo ebyaliwo nga Ssebutemba 11, Abamerika baatandika okutwaala ensi yonna ekulemberwa Abasiraamu okuba ey'obulabe eri enkulaakulana.

translation.en: It piled all Muslims behind Osama bin Laden, which Americans had managed to subdue all along.
translation.lug: Kino kyateeka Abasiraamu bonna emabega wa Osama bi Laden, ate nga Amerika yali ekirinye ku nfeete.

translation.en: In America’s new frontlines, Aljazeera journalists Rageh Omar and Muhammad Adow who were born in Somalia note how the Union of Islamic Courts had brought peace to that country.
translation.lug: Ekibiina ky'Abasiraamu kyali kisodde okuleeta emirembe mu nsi eyo.

translation.en: Warlords in the North, who surely thrived under chaos, were shocked by the rapid spread of peace and popularity of the courts.
translation.lug: Abalwanyi abali mu mambuka ababaddewo mu bugubi baawuniikirira bwe baalaba engeri emirembe n'obuganzi bwe byaddawo amangu.

translation.en: They were not alone though, they had another equally distraught friend  and that was America.
translation.lug: Weewawo si beeboka, waliwo ne bannabwe abalala abaawuniikirira era bano nga be Abamerika.

translation.en: Fear: Was the headline on September 11th as the rest of the world; “saw a country struck by amnesia”.
translation.lug: Okutya: Gwe ggwali omutwe omukulu mu mawulire ga Ssebutemba 11 ng'abantu bonna mu nsi "balaba ensi eri mu kusoberwa."

translation.en: Misled by the hypothesis of “clash of civilisations”, America was fearful of another stable Muslim led regime, which they thought would provide haven for jihadists.
translation.lug: Olw'okuwubisibwa embeera eyaliwo ekontana n'obugunjufu, Amerika yalina okutya eri gavumenti yonna ekulemberwa Abasiraamu nga balowooza nti yanditumbudde obwannalukalala.

translation.en: In usual American fashion, the United States sought to bring the union of Islamic Courts down.
translation.lug: Amerika yali eyagala okusanyalaza ekibiina ky'abasiraamu okuyitira mu nkola yaabwe eya bulijjo ey'Ekimerika.

translation.en: Using the Central Intelligence Agency, it secretly shuttled cash and ammunitions to warlord controlled parts of Mogadishu.
translation.lug: Nga bakozesa abakkesi baabwe, mu ngeri enneekusifu baawereza ssente n'eby'okulwanyisa eri abalwanyi abaali beefuze ebitundu ebitali bimu mu Mogadishu.

translation.en: Faced with defeat in this move, with pro Courts Somalis staging a well choreographed and spirited defence, America sought conspiracy with Somalia’s arch enemy, Ethiopia.
translation.lug: Bwe baalemesebwa Abasomaali okukola kino, olwo Amerika n'etandika okukolagana ne Esopiya abaali abalabe ba Abasomaali abasingirayo ddala.

translation.en: Somalia was sent to the dogs.
translation.lug: Abasomaliya ne basindikibwa eri embwa

translation.en: Somalis are angry.
translation.lug: Abasomaliya banyiivu

translation.en: And as Franz Fanon has written “man is no to scorn of man, a no to the degradation of man, a no to the exploitation of man.
translation.lug: Era nga Franz Fanon bwe yawandiika "omuntu tanyomeka, omuntu tayisibwamu maaso, omuntu tabbika.

translation.en: ”And in the defeat of the Islamic Courts militia in 2005, an angry wing was born, the Al-Shabaab". Franz continues to write.
translation.lug: Akabinja k'Abasiramu abalwanyi bwe kaawangulibwa mu 2005, akalala ak'omutawaana akayitibwa Al-Shabaab ne katandikibwawo". Bw'atyo Franz bwe yeeyogera okuwandiika

translation.en: It emerged fighting Ethiopia, America and all its allies.
translation.lug: Kaatandika okulwanyisa Esopia, Abamerika awamu n'eb'emikago bonna.

translation.en: It is at this point that Uganda sends troops to Somalia on a peacekeeping mission.
translation.lug: Mu kiseera kino Uganda w'esindikira amaggye mu Somaliya okukuuma emirembe.

translation.en: Viewed through the lens of a conspirator, Uganda has imported terror in an attempt to export peace.
translation.lug: Olw'okuba baatwalibwa okuba abaseketerezi, mu kugezaako okutwalayo emirembe yo Uganda effunyeemu bukyayi.

translation.en: But the most unfortunate part of this bargain for America, and specifically for helpless Uganda is that the attack was on a Muslim country.
translation.lug: Naye ekibi ennyo ekivudde mu kuyamba Amereka, kwe kuba nti Uganda yalumba ensi y'Abasiraamu.

translation.en: But as G.W Hegel has written in respect to the 1789 French revolution, men are able to die for a cause of greater value than life itself.
translation.lug: Naye nga G.W Hegel bwe yawandiika ku bikwata ku nkyukakyuka eyaliwo mu Bufalaansa mu 1789, abantu basobola okufiiririra ekintu kyonna eky'omuwendo okusinga obulamu.

translation.en: At that rate, Hegel added that they were ready to kill for the same cause.
translation.lug: Bw'atyo Hegel yagattako nti baali beetegefu okutta.

translation.en: But with a misguided cultural talk, Ugandans have the potential to drag their Muslim compatriots into supporting Al-Shabaab.
translation.lug: Naye olw'obutamanya, Bannayuganda basobola okukubiriza Basiraamu bannaabwe okuwagira aba Al-Shabaab.

translation.en: Culture talk, Al-Shabaab and political Islam Hijab covered Muslim girls, and men with long beards or those wearing turbans are the unfortunate ones.
translation.lug: Enjogera eyeekuusa ku buwangwa, Al-Shabaab n'ekibiina ky'eby'obufuzi eky'abawala Abasiraamu abeebikirira n'abasajja abalina ebirevu ebiwanvu era abambala ebiremba be bali mu katyabaga

translation.en: Mwenda read with particular keenness President Yoweri Museveni’s article on July 25, where he defended Ugandan troop presence in Somalia.
